conclusion: Analyze thermodynamic processes in the p-V diagram from state A to state C.
State A to B is an isochoric process with constant volume at 2 x 10^-3 m^3 and pressure decreases from 3 x 10^5 Pa to 2 x 10^5 Pa.
State B to C is an isobaric process with constant pressure at 2 x 10^5 Pa and volume increases from 2 x 10^-3 m^3 to 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
Use the first law of thermodynamics: Q = ΔU + W.
For an ideal gas, ΔU = n Cv ΔT and W = P ΔV for isobaric processes.
In isochoric process from A to B, work done W = 0 since ΔV = 0.
Heat transferred Q_AB = ΔU = n Cv ΔT for process A to B.
Use ideal gas law: PV = nRT to calculate ΔT.
Calculate T_A using ideal gas law: T_A = (P_A V) / (n R).
Calculate T_B using ideal gas law: T_B = (P_B V) / (n R).
Calculate ΔT_AB = T_B - T_A = (V / n R) (P_B - P_A).
Substitute values to find ΔT_AB = -200 / (n R) K.
Calculate heat transferred Q_AB = n Cv (-200 / n R).
In isobaric process from B to C, calculate work done W_BC = P ΔV.
Substitute values to find W_BC = 2 x 10^5 x (3 x 10^-3 - 2 x 10^-3).
